author: brent.allsop
content:
Time and time again, people have implemented voting ‚Äúon chain‚Äù  The once great but now failed (or subsumed by EOS) Bitshares is a good example.  Even when everyone can vote, not nearly enough people take the initiative to make the vote legitimate.  Limiting this further, by only allowing a random subset of the group to vote, would only make this situation worse.  To say nothing of the fact that you‚Äôd likely lose the one first expert who knows how to save society.  Any system must be able to work, even if only a few people are willing to get involved.  You need to know what everyone wants, concisely and quantitatively, with no compromise and no censoring of anyone.

And there must be ‚Äúexperts‚Äù people trust. (i.e. influencers)  Not everyone can be an expert on everything.  With canonizer, we have infinite, real time delegation, different for each topic.  My kids delegate to me, I delegate to my friend who knows more than I do on a particular issue, who delegates to someone he knows is the words greatest expert, on that ONE issue.  (i.e. checks and balances built in because every topic has a unique expertise tree)  Then, when an expert to whom 70% of the population has delegated their vote to jumps camps, the entire organization can change, instantly, on a dime, easily outperforming any singular hierarchical organization at large scale.

And, since it is real time.  If that guy screws up, everyone can instantly delegate their vote to someone else.

author: alita85
content: this assumes that those whom would normally take the initiative are spread out perfectly evenly. It also ignores that people given a feeling of importance (by being the 0.03% chosen to participate) are far more likely to be involved than those not. To maintain a feeling of involvement throughout the whole system, it would merely require more frequent decisions to be taken by the people. In this case, if you know nothing and are given the oppurtunity the vote and want to do so, then you are likely to research the topic and get a much more broad view of the problem. Including the claims of a super hero expert. In other words, the influencers ability to influence the vote is still intact but more distant to avoid direct manipulation.

author: alita85
content: additionally, a system like this which is based on general participation in the network would encourage more participation in general, growing the network, growing the pool, growing the validity of the democracy.
